edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.Engine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Engine is what runs the actual statistics and calculations of the game. For this, the class also creates the grid that the game will be based on. The engine will also contain methods to manipulate the grid, based on how the user and the enemies move and if they are still in the game or not. The engine specifies everything from creating the player, the enemies, the rooms, and the powerups, then placing them into the grid for manipulation. This allows for the engine to do things that require the access to its grid, without the need to access them elsewhere. Engines are important to the design and implmentation of any program, as they are the classes that gather the information and manipulate them when needed.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duoung, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setReveal

        public void setReveal(boolean set)
        Allows the grid to be revealed depending on the variable {@link reveal}. If true, the grid will display the symbols and locations of the enemies, document and powerups.
        Parameters:
        set - - the boolean to determine whether the grid should be revealed.

      • setPowers

        public void setPowers()
        places the power ups into the grid. The power ups are placed randomly in the grid.

      • isPowerupActivated

        public boolean isPowerupActivated(int number)
        Once the player walks on top of a power up, the power up will activate depending on what it does. the method will then return the current state of the powerup, in which the power up is deactivated for the duration of the level.
        Parameters:
        number - - the certain power up in the array of powerups.
        Returns:
        active - the current state of the power up, if it is still active or not.

      • setRooms

        public void setRooms()
        Method used to set the rooms into the grid. After setting, the document is then randomly placed into a room, which is choosen randomly.

      • setEnemies

        public void setEnemies(int number)
        Creates the enemies, organizes them into their own array, and then places each one randomly into the world, or grid.
        Parameters:
        number - - specifies how many enemies to place into the grid.

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(int number)
        moves the player in the grid, depending on the direction of where the player wishes to move. Player moves along the grid, but cannot move through rooms or outside the world.
        Parameters:
        number - - the direction where the player wishes to move.

      • moveEnemy

        public boolean moveEnemy()
        moves the enemy in a random direction. Each enemy, in turn, is removed from their original positions on the grid, and placed into their new positions, depending on which direction they moved. Before doing so however, each enemy checks to see if a player is adjacent to their current position before moving. If so, the player will be stabbed.
        Returns:
        success - value to determine whether the enemy has successfully stabbed the player.

      • look

        public boolean look(int number)
        returns the value of whether the player has spotted the enemy or not.
        Parameters:
        number - - the direction of which the player chooses to look.
        Returns:
        spotted - boolean value that determines whether an enemy is spotted.

      • shoot

        public int shoot(int number)
        Allows the player to shoot the enemy, based on how many bullets the player currently possesses.
        Parameters:
        number - - the direction at which the player shoots.
        Returns:
        counter - the number of enemies killed by that one bullet.
